page.title: 18TRULY RURAL PERSON (cont)
page.content: The harvest was slow, providing fun and community spirit for all participants, and lasting for weeks whereas latterly she would see the field on the morning of a school day and by evening only bales were left - quite a shock! The community used to have a moving population - farm workers would be employed for a year from either the May or November term. If a man was jobless then the community would team up and help the family. Depopulation has meant total loss of community spirit which existed in the form of Womens Guild, WRI, Whist Drives, Dances, etc. Church roll and attendance has not changed significantly. Attendance used to depend more strongly on the weather when members walked to the service whereas today the car is used.
